Description: Book of the Dead of Ankhwahibra; frame 24; black line vignettes; Hieratic text in red and black.
Curator's comments: To be published by Svenja Guelden (University of Mainz). Bibliography: Wüthrich, A., Édition synoptique et traduction des chapitres supplémentaires du Livre des Morts 162 à 167 (Studien zu Altägyptischen Totentexten 19,1, 2). Wiesbaden 2015. Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (23)
Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (no. 71)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57267) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57267)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 July - September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: Conserved 2012; bleached, brittle, fractured, loss, frayed, delaminating Black ink (abraded) Red ink (abraded) Backed: linen Supported edges: Japanese paper Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Loan to Japan 2012 'Journey through the Afterlife' exhibition. Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: D Curatorial condition comment: good
